page.title: 07VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Morland is a growing and very active village.There are 112 houses,two inns,The Crown and King's Arms,a village shop/tearooms,an ancient church, a modern school and two garages.Water, sewerage and electricity are all provided and Eden Dist.Council provides a rubbish collection and street lighting service.There is only one bus per week which runs to Penrith on market day,Tuesday. Sport and leisure activities are well served.There is a cricket club with a field along Water Street.A playing field offers a full size soccer pitch and child play equipment.The shared village hall/school facilities include, tennis and badmington courts,an infant play area and school field and playground.All areas are used fully.
